content.webTitle: Football: Kilmarnock will not sign Caballero unless he lowers wage demands

fields.headline: Killie say caramba to Caballero's demands
fields.bodyText: Kilmarnock have told Fabián Caballero that they will not sign him unless he moderates his wage demands. "What he is asking for is not within our budget," said the club's general manager David MacKinnon. "He indicated that he was looking for a sum of money per week that we could not enter into," MacKinnon said yesterday. "He is a player we would be delighted to have but unless he was prepared to lower his demands we can't offer him a deal." Aberdeen and Dunfermline have also expressed an interest in signing the Argentinian striker released by Dundee after they went into administration, but MacKinnon doubts that they will be prepared to meet his demands either. "Things have changed," he said. "I'm sure everyone is getting a bit more realistic now. I would be very, very surprised if Aberdeen or Dunfermline could offer him any better than what we could." ·A minute's silence will be observed before this weekend's Tennent's Scottish Cup matches in honour of the former Scotland manager Ally MacLeod.
